A Guide to Applying for Astronomy Postdocs

A series of online workshops
June-July, 2025


Expression of Interest Form

GAAP (Guide to Applying for Astronomy Postdocs) is a series of online workshops designed for prospective postdocs in astronomy. The initiative aims to support emerging astronomers who are looking to transition, or bridge the gap, from graduate studies to postdoctoral research positions, as well as from one postdoctoral position to another. The series is jointly organized by the Graduate Student Committee (GSC) and the Postdoctoral Committee (PDC) of the Canadian Astronomical Society / Société Canadienne d'Astronomie (CASCA), and is running for the first time in summer 2025.

The GAAP workshop sessions will provide helpful information and experiential insights about the process of applying for postdoctoral positions and fellowships. The events will also serve as a platform for discussions and opportunity for applicants to forge supportive connections with other applicants. We invite participation from students or recent graduates engaged in astronomy research who are interested in pursing postdoctoral research opportunities, particularly senior graduate students in Canada.

Important Dates

  • February 28th, 2025: The Expression of Interest form opens! If you are interested in attending any of the sessions, or have questions you'd like us to cover during the workshops, please complete the form!

  • April, 2025: Registration opens and the series program details will be announced.

  • Week of June 16th, 2025: Join us for Session 1 of GAAP!

  • Week of June 30th, 2025: Join us for Session 2 of GAAP!

  • Week of July 14th, 2025: Join us for Session 3 of GAAP!

  • Week of June 28th, 2025: Join us for Session 4 of GAAP!

Session 1. The Fundamentals of Applying to Postdoctoral Positions

Date & time to be announced (2-hour online workshop during week of June 16th, 2025)

  • Essential tips & tricks; where opportunities are advertised; types of opportunities available; typical components of an application; timeline of the application and selection processes

  • Setting priorities and expectations; statistics to be aware of; the importance of organization tools and communication

Session 2. Writing Your Research Proposal

Date & time to be announced (2-hour online workshop during week of June 30th, 2025)

  • Why this is the most important component of your application and what it accomplishes

  • The qualities of a strong proposal; where to find examples; when & how to start writing

Session 3. Interview Preparation // Two Sides of the Hiring Process

Date & time to be announced (2-hour online workshop during week of July 14th, 2025)

  • What an interview accomplishes, from the perspective of both sides: the selection committee and the applicant

  • How to prepare for an interview; typical formats; what to put in your presentation; questions you may be asked; questions you may ask

  • Featuring guest speakers: Testimonies and insights shared from folks who have served on selection committees (representation from NSERC, USA, overseas)

Session 4. The Many Possible Paths // Maintaining Mental Wellbeing During Application Season

Date & time to be announced (2-hour online workshop during week of July 28th, 2025)

  • Differences amongst postdoctoral systems and hiring structures across the globe

  • How everyone's path is different; representation of the diversity of considerations to making decisions

  • Featuring guest speakers: Testimonies and advice from previous or current postdocs with diverse experiences from around the world

Organizers


  • Adrien Hélias, CASCA Graduate Student Committee (Western University)

  • Jess Speedie, CASCA Graduate Student Committee (University of Victoria)

  • Veronika Dornan, CASCA Graduate Student Committee (McMaster University)

  • Isabel Sander, CASCA Graduate Student Committee (University of Manitoba)

  • Emily Deibert, CASCA Postdoctoral Committee (Gemini Observatory/NSF's NOIRLab)

  • Matías Bravo, CASCA Postdoctoral Committee (McMaster University)
